Trial_Design.evidence: This was a secondary analysis of data from an earlier cluster-randomized trial

Participants.evidence: Between April 2019 and December 2020, 1339 of 1679 eligible patients were included in this study

Intervention.evidence: the two participating hospitals were randomized to administer aspirin (100 mg daily) or enoxaparin (40 mg daily)

Objective.evidence: Questions/purposes: (1) Is the type of VTE prophylaxis (enoxaparin or aspirin) used after hip arthroplasty or knee arthroplasty associated with a higher risk of persistent wound drainage?

Method_Outcome.evidence: Persistent wound drainage was defined as any wound drainage beyond Postoperative Day 3

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: the two participating hospitals were randomized

Blinding.evidence: Assessors were not blinded to the type of prophylaxis each patient received

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between April 2019 and December 2020, 1339 of 1679 eligible patients were included in this study

Number_Analysed.evidence: 65 in the enoxaparin group and 49 in the aspirin group

Result_Outcome.evidence: odds ratio 1.2 [95% confidence interval 0.8 to 1.8]; p = 0.40
